text: [Applause]
no Jeff Bezos did not announce the new
fire phone but Amazon did just hold an
event where they announced a whole bunch
of new devices Amazon is not streaming
the event but we are here to wrap it up
for you
the first product Amazon showed off was
the echo dot with clock just like the
echo dot but with LEDs to display things
like time temperature and alarms it's
priced at $59.99 and is now available
for pre-order on Amazon and speaking of
echo Amazon is adding another voice to
its Alexa assistant samuel l.jackson
he'll tell jokes set alarms and do
everything else the Alexa assistant
already does it'll come in two versions
explicit and not explicit the regular
echo is also getting an update the new
echo model will come with the same sound
system as the echo plus plus a three
inch woofer it also comes in a fabric
design and in colors like charcoal
heather gray sandstone and Twilight blue
the new third generation echo will cost
the same as the previous year's second
gen model ninety-nine bucks from there
Amazon announced a whole new product the
echoes studio it's a smart speaker with
3d audio like Dolby Atmos the echo
studio uses built-in microphones to
calibrate and model the room around you
and adjust the speaker accordingly to
create the best sound no matter where
it's placed it has multiple speakers to
create directional sound and a five and
a quarter inch bass driver it can
connect with 4k fire TVs it costs $200
and you can pre-order it now next came a
new echo show the echo show 8 it's a lot
like the previous echo show but this one
comes with an 8 inch HD display and cost
130 dollars look at this thing it's the
echo glow a small lamp that changes
color it doesn't have a LexA built-in
but it does connect with devices like
the echo dot instead it has different
modes like dance party and slick green
campfire Amazon says it will ship in
time for the holidays and it costs $30
Amazon's mesh router line arrow is also
getting an upgrade Alexa can now manage
Wi-Fi access with commands like turn on
the guest Wi-Fi and pause the Wi-Fi for
dinner the new arrow launches today and
it's $99 or you can get it in a three
pack for 249 dollars the next unveiling
was the echo flex looking a little bit
like a Glade plugin this tiny device
serves as an access point for other
smart home devices like smart sensors
and night lights and it also has alexa
built in it also has a USB port to
charge your phone and other devices and
it's available for pre-order now at $25
Amazon's ring stick up camera is getting
an upgrade the new model can run indoors
and out off its battery or plugged into
a wall and it is available for pre-order
now at $100 also being added to the Ring
lineup is the ring indoor cam it'll have
most of the features that the other ring
cams do but this one will cost $60 of
course it would not be an Amazon event
without some interesting home products
Amazon did not disappoint when it showed
off the Amazon smart oven a combination
microwave oven air fryer and food warmer
just asked Alexa to cook common foods
using already loaded presets and she'll
tell you when they're finished or when
it's just time to stir it a little bit
the oven is available for pre-order now
it's $250 and will ship with a bonus
echo dot after talking about Amazon
Sidewalk a new low bandwidth network
used to extend the distance needed to
control simple devices like smart lights
Amazon announced fetch attached to your
dog's collar fetch uses Sidewalk to let
you know if your dogs left a certain
area it's gonna be available next year
finally Amazon showed off the long
rumored echo buds echo buds offer access
to Alexa but will require a phone to
work the buds themselves have 5 hours of
battery life but with the case you get
20 the earbuds have Bose active noise
reduction technology and can also access
Siri or the Google assistant on your
phone echo buds are available for
pre-order now for a
and $30 and they'll start shipping in
October Amazon then showed off a couple
products from its day one editions line
up the day one editions are products
made in limited volume with the goal
being to get feedback from customers
before they go all in and make for the
first day one edition is EKKO frames
Alexa enabled glasses they don't have a
camera or a display they are solely made
to talk to Alexa the other day one
edition is the echo loop an Alexa
enabled smart ring it has two
microphones a built-in speaker and a
haptic engine so you can feel the
vibrations from notifications and
confirmations echo frames will be
available for one hundred and eighty
dollars during its invite period and at
the loop will be available for a hundred
dollars during its invite period and
both will ship later this year and that
was what Amazon showed off today if
there's anything that you're super
excited about or disappointed they
didn't show off let us know in the
comments
